name: Network Threat Protection
description: Sector template for network-level threat protection patents including malware detection, intrusion detection/prevention, threat intelligence, and network security monitoring.
contextDescription: Network threat protection patents cover technologies that detect, prevent, and respond to network-based attacks. This includes IDS/IPS, DDoS mitigation, malware detection at the network layer, threat intelligence integration, security analytics, XDR/NDR platforms, and temporal attack analysis.
scoringGuidance: Detection patents should be scored on their ability to identify unknown/zero-day threats vs only known signatures.
Patents using ML/AI for behavioral analysis score higher on detection_method.
Real-time inline protection scores higher than post-facto analysis.
Integration with threat intelligence feeds and automated response increases value.
XDR/NDR platform patents that correlate across endpoints and network are high value.
Temporal/behavioral analysis patents that detect APT campaigns over time are emerging high-value areas.

questions.question: What threat detection methodology is used? Score 1-3 for signature-based only, 4-6 for heuristic/behavioral patterns, 7-10 for advanced ML/AI-based anomaly detection.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the detection approach: signatures, heuristics, or ML-based.

questions.question: What types of threats does this patent address? Score 1-3 for single threat type (e.g., just DDoS), 4-6 for multiple threat categories, 7-10 for comprehensive coverage (malware, intrusion, DDoS, exfiltration).
questions.reasoningPrompt: List the threat types covered: malware, intrusion, DDoS, APT, exfiltration, etc.

questions.question: What is the response capability? Score 1-3 for alerting only, 4-6 for semi-automated response, 7-10 for real-time automated prevention/blocking.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess whether it alerts, quarantines, blocks, or takes automated action.

questions.question: How much network visibility does this patent provide? Score 1-3 for single point monitoring, 4-6 for segment/zone visibility, 7-10 for full network visibility (east-west, north-south traffic).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the network monitoring scope and traffic visibility.

questions.question: Does this patent integrate with or enhance threat intelligence? Score 1-3 if none, 4-6 for threat feed consumption, 7-10 for active threat intelligence sharing/enrichment.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess threat intelligence capabilities: feeds, IoC sharing, enrichment.

questions.question: Does this patent align with XDR/NDR platform capabilities? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for single-domain detection, 7-10 for cross-domain correlation (network + endpoint + cloud).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess XDR/NDR applicability and cross-domain detection correlation.

questions.question: Does this patent use temporal or behavioral analysis? Score 1-3 if point-in-time only, 4-6 for session-level behavior, 7-10 for long-term temporal analysis (APT campaign detection, connection graphs over time).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess temporal analysis depth: point-in-time, session, or campaign-level.
